Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Katherine E. Hepler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Katherine E. Hepler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Katherine E. Hepler was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Violation of Judgment of Conviction.  Judge Hepler suspended huber privileges from 6-19-17 to 7-19-17.
Notice of Violation of JOC;  Judge White imposed new report date of 6-5-17 at 7 PM.  Defendant notified by clerk 6-2-17 via telephone message.
Filed by defendant/counsel.
Filed by defendant/counsel.

ADA Troy Cross appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person in custody with Atty Mark Bennett on 16CF299 and with Atty Charles Giesen on 15CF496 and 16CM64.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct 7 in 16CF299 Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance and Ct 2 in 15CF496.  Court withheld sentence and placed defendant on 4 years probation in each case.  Conditions:  $2198 fine, 6 months jail in each case consecutive with huber and good time. Jail time to begin first in 15CF496. May attend court on 6-19-17 and attend any legal proceedings.   Submit DNA sample/$250 DNA surcharge.  No illegal substance and maintain absolute sobriety.  36 month revocation/36 month interlock/AODA.  $65.00 Blood Draw Reimbursement.   3 days jail credit in 16CF299.  Dismiss remainder of charges and 16CM64 dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Atty. Giesen requests March 20 hearing be reset. - fax
Filed by atty Giesen, requesting a reset of the plea/sentencing hearing on 3-20-17 at 11:00.  State has no objection.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 20, 2017 at 11:00 am.

9:22 A.M., Defendant Katherine E. Hepler in court with attorney Charles W Giesen.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, counsel requesting separate time for plea/sentencing hearing, counsel to contact Br. 3 JA, 9:29 A.M.

Cases called: 16CF299, 15CF496, 16CM64, Defendant Katherine E. Hepler in court with attorneys Mark H Bennett and  Charles Giesen.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Reset requested. Both felonies set for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.
for Return Date on 12/9/16 @ 2:45 p.m.

Defendant Katherine E. Hepler in court with attorney Charles W Giesen.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF496, 16CM64, and 16CF299.  Defendant has applied for public defender in 16CF299.  In 15CF496 and 16CM64 atty Giesen requested a new pretrial and return date.  State had no objection.  In 16CF299, defendant filed petition for court appointed attorney.  Court found defendant indigent.  Appointed attorney Mark Bennett.  Defendant is to pay $25.00/mo. starting on 9-15-16.
